Package com.sync.db

Class SyncDB

java.lang.Object
com.sync.db.SyncDB
public class SyncDB extends Object
This class manage all the functions and operations of the database. This is a utility class that contain only static methods. Make sure to initialize it before using any database method. Use static init() method passing a directory where the database should be created. The data must be a SyncedData or a another wrapper class of this database.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Rahil khan

  • Method Details

    • syncAll

      public static void syncAll(com.sync.db.Syncable... variables)
      Syncs all the data with the database. Call this method as soon as possible passing every syncable that you wish to save in database. These syncable are automatically synced with database, Means that these will automatically be updated in the database everytime you modify it. Note : Order of arguments is important. The order must be same as it was on first time, Otherwise serious bugs can be found.
      Parameters:
      variables - The syncables you want to save in the database.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If database was not initialized.

    • initAndSync

      public static void initAndSync(File databaseDir, Class<?> callingClass, com.sync.db.Syncable... variables)
      Convenience method of syncAll(Syncable[]) that will also initialize the database with every feature off.
      Parameters:
      databaseDir - The directory where the database will be created
      variables - Data you want to store.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any argument is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - If file is not a directory
      SecurityException - If directory is not writable

    • init

      public static void init(File databaseDir, Class<?> callingClass, boolean commitAsync)
      Initialize the database.
      Parameters:
      databaseDir - The directory where the database will be created
      commitAsync - Weather to commit in a background thread ? (This is IO operation)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If any argument is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - If file is not a directory
      SecurityException - If directory is not writable

    • commit

      public static void commit()
      Commits all the changes to the database. This method must be last call of the class. Calling this method will nullify and close all the streams related to database. Any method attempt to call after this may result in NullPointerException
